indications:
Indications enhance permeation of subcutaneous or intramuscular injections, local anaesthetics and subcutaneous infusions; promote
resorption of excess fluids and blood
name: HYALURONIDASE
breadcrumbs:
10.3 Drugs for the treatment of soft-tissue disorders and topical pain
relief
cautions:
Cautions infants or elderly (control speed and total volume
and avoid overhydration especially in renal impairment)
side-effects:
Side-effects oedema; rarely local irritation,
infection, bleeding, bruising; occasional severe allergy (including
anaphylaxis)
doses:
With subcutaneous or intramuscular injection, 1500 units dissolved directly in solution to be injected (ensure
compatibility)

With local anaesthetics, 1500 units mixed
with local anaesthetic solution (ophthalmology, 15 units/mL)

Hypodermoclysis, 1500 units dissolved in 1 mL water for injections
or 0.9% sodium chloride injection, administered
before start of 500–1000 mL infusion fluid

Extravasation (see notes above) or haematoma, 1500 units dissolved in 1 mL
water for injections or 0.9% sodium chloride injection,
infiltrated into affected area (as soon as possible after extravasation)
